intro: Stachytarpheta angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of violet to blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Stachytarpheta angustifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
